positive.review: Good kung fu game. Ancient China, very good story and featured. It has an English translation made by fan. Have a good game.

This game is superb so far. A large amount of freedom. Variety of gameplay. Looking forward to see what comes next in my playthrough. There is a learning curve but not as bad as some games. I usually ask AI specifically to check Chinese language forums if there is a mechanic I don't understand. So happy to have found the game though. Looking forward to 1.0.

Where to begin.......
I've played this game for 1700 hours and I'll likely play it for 10,000 more.
I've played this game since the characters were jank and looked like they were drawn by 10 year olds.
I've played this game since before the moves had animations and you had to imagine what the attack effects would look like.
I've played this game since the dark ages. My childrens children will likely play this game.
With all that said, if you love Wuxia sims, this is THE game to play.

THAT BEING SAID: the following is also true.....
The game was made primarily for the chinese audience, therefore there's no official english translation.
The devs have been saying the English translation is coming, however the release has a history of getting pushed back.
The English Mod DOES exist and it's come a LONG way through the efforts of Li Wei and the gang of the discord. That being said, it's still very much imperfect. A small unofficial (unpaid) mod team with personal lives can only do so much.

IF the current English Mod is too abrasive for you, you will not like this game.

If you can accept the English Mod as it is, this is objectively one of THE BEST GAMES OUT PERIOD. 
I would pay $60 for this game. Let alone $20. I have games that I've paid more for that give SIGNIFICANTLY less content than this game does.

Not to mention, despite their flaws, the devs do constantly update and upgrade the game. You can tell the game itself is a labor of love. They want to build something fun, even if some understandably don't agree with how they're building it.
Good kung fu game. Ancient China, very good story and featured. It has an English translation made by fan. Have a good game.

This game is superb so far. A large amount of freedom. Variety of gameplay. Looking forward to see what comes next in my playthrough. There is a learning curve but not as bad as some games. I usually ask AI specifically to check Chinese language forums if there is a mechanic I don't understand. So happy to have found the game though. Looking forward to 1.0.
如果没有橡树，那我就是最大的橡树！桀桀桀！

IF the current English Mod is too abrasive for you, you will not like this game.

If you can accept the English Mod as it is, this is objectively one of THE BEST GAMES OUT PERIOD. 
I would pay $60 for this game. Let alone $20. I have games that I've paid more for that give SIGNIFICANTLY less content than this game does.

Not to mention, despite their flaws, the devs do constantly update and upgrade the game. You can tell the game itself is a labor of love. They want to build something fun, even if some understandably don't agree with how they're building it.
Good kung fu game. Ancient China, very good story and featured. It has an English translation made by fan. Have a good game.

This game is superb so far. A large amount of freedom. Variety of gameplay. Looking forward to see what comes next in my playthrough. There is a learning curve but not as bad as some games. I usually ask AI specifically to check Chinese language forums if there is a mechanic I don't understand. So happy to have found the game though. Looking forward to 1.0.
如果没有橡树，那我就是最大的橡树！桀桀桀！

#1 Game of any genre

on par with FromJianghu, if not better
WHEEEEEEEEEEEENNNNNNNNNNNNNNN ENGLISH TRANSLATION GONNA RELEASEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE OH GOD PLEASEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE

Where to begin.......
I've played this game for 1700 hours and I'll likely play it for 10,000 more.
I've played this game since the characters were jank and looked like they were drawn by 10 year olds.
I've played this game since before the moves had animations and you had to imagine what the attack effects would look like.
I've played this game since the dark ages. My childrens children will likely play this game.
With all that said, if you love Wuxia sims, this is THE game to play.
